function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of theoretical insights on the role of 5g in pandemic prevention and control","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of distributed work on distance decay","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Concepts like \"death of distance\" and \"friction of distance\" minimizing the impact of geographical distance","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interacting with people from faraway towns through the internet may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if proper precautions are not taken.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promoting distance learning and telecommuting through synchronous communication and video conferences may lead to the transmission of contagious diseases if preventive measures are not implemented.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of disease transmission risks in virtual interactions may result in the continuation of contagious disease spread despite advancements in remote technologies.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The use of de-spatialization and spatialization in pandemic control may lead to a misunderstanding of the objectives and strategies in disease prevention.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Automation and use of driverless vehicles and robots may lead to a reduction in the availability of human resources for pandemic prevention and control.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited adoption and application of 5g technology due to challenges in network structure and lack of application scenarios.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate attention to 5g’s social and business values due to focus on technological aspects and lack of commercial usage.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on telemedicine for diagnosis and treatment","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mental health impact during lockdown","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate research and production of test toolkits for disease detection","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of social systems making lockdown implementation difficult","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in controlling sporadic outbreaks in well-controlled areas","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lagging development of vaccines and medicine","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited use of 5g technology","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependency on combination of digital technologies for epidemic prevention","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential misinformation about the role of 5g in covid-19 prevention and control","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on 5g technology may lead to neglect of other important preventive measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited accessibility to 5g technology may exacerbate existing health disparities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to prolonged stay-at-home orders and quarantine measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects and mental health impacts of prolonged lockdown measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on non-communicable diseases ncds due to decreased physical activity during lockdown","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the impact of built environment on mental health","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited evidence and diverse research findings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in healthcare and working facilities","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large sample survey during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Anonymity and confidentiality in survey","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mental health impact assessment","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The assessment contains questions about anxiety symptoms and severity, insomnia severity, and impulsivity levels, which may indicate mental health risks.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of poor indoor quality including natural lighting, acoustic comfort, thermo-hygrometric comfort, and privacy during phone calls","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of high depressive symptoms among students","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Association between architectural parameters and depressive symptoms","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagation due to a large number of students in a shared environment.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor housing conditions contributing to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms in students","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative psychological effects of quarantine during infectious disease outbreaks","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential impact of built environment on physical and mental health of individuals and community","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor housing quality and inadequate indoor facilities are related to depressive symptoms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of natural lighting, acoustic comfort, and privacy in living quarters is associated with severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor-quality views from the apartment are linked to moderate-severe and severe depressive symptoms.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social isolation and poor housing quality impact working performance and productivity during lockdown, potentially exacerbating mental health issues.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear work-leisure boundaries and productivity-enhancing environment in small apartments may lead to decreased productivity and work-life imbalance.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor housing physical conditions may impact physical health and contribute to health inequalities during long-term stay-at-home periods.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliability bias in self-reporting questionnaires due to under-reporting, under-estimating, and misunderstanding of mental health issues","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of cross-sectional study design in determining temporal relationships between variables","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of results due to low response rate and recruitment from a single university","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of larger and more livable living spaces facing green areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Interdisciplinary approach and investigation needed","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centrality of welfare and housing policies in population well-being","category":"Society","confidence":"High"}]}
